node.category: What is the way things are?
Should there be a death penalty?

node.surface: No human being or human committee should again be given the permission to rule over 'life or death'.

node.category: Why shouldn't humans be able to determine the death penalty?

node.surface: Courts are also subject to human error.
That's why Germany should not introduce capital punishment!

node.category: Why is human error dangerous when dealing with such a serious punishment?

node.surface: Every human, even those who have committed a despicable crime, can bring themselves to regret and change their opinion.

node.category: Should there be a path left open for criminals to change their minds?

node.surface: A door must remain open for making amends.
